trans-unit.source: Represents the encrypted key encrypting credentials.
These are usually used as data encrypting credentials to encrypt things like tokens.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyEncryptingCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate.
Use this constructor if the wrapping credential is an X.509 certificate and you want to use the default wrapping algorithm and encryption algorithm, which are RSA-OAEP and AES256 respectively.
The certificate used to encrypt the key.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyEncryptingCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials"></xref> object, key size, and encryption algorithm.
Use this constructor if you already have an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials> object and you want to use it as a wrapping credential.
The key wrapping credentials used to encrypt the session key.
The key size of the wrapped session key.
A URI that represents the encryption algorithm when the session key is used.
This should be a symmetric key algorithm.
wrappingCredentials is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyEncryptingCredentials"></xref> class based on the specified X.509 certificate, wrapping algorithm, key size, and encryption algorithm.
Use this constructor if the wrapping credential is an X.509 certificate and you want to supply your own wrapping algorithm and encryption algorithm.
The certificate used to encrypt the key.
A URI that represents the key wrapping algorithm.
This should be an asymmetric algorithm.
The key size of the wrapped session key.
A URI that represents the encryption algorithm when the session key is used.
This should be a symmetric key algorithm.
Gets the key wrapping credentials used to encrypt the session key; for example, <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509EncryptingCredentials"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials"></xref> that represents the credentials used to encrypt the session key.
